sources.title: Phantom Of The Opera (Original Soundtrack)
sources.description: 1925 directed by Rupert Julian starring Lon Chaney, Mary Philbin, Norman Kerry and Arthur Edmund Carewe with Gibson Gowland, John st. Polis, Snitz Edwards, Mary Fabian and Virginia Pearson. A disfigured escapee from the Prison for the Criminally insane lives in the old cellars beneath the Paris Opera House and becomes obsessed with a young singer. Soundtrack is composed of #42 Pre-Human Spawn of Cthulhu and a portion of #159 White as the Petals of Some Water Flower, by Bull of Heaven, with some added sounds. This version has the color sequence at the Bal Masque.

metadata.Plot: Where would our favorite movies be without the music that fuels them? From the Top Gun jets soaring through the Danger Zone to everybody shaking' their Bacon in Footloose, music is an undeniable character in film, a character that can bring as much to a scene as any actor's performance. "Original Motion Picture Soundtrack" celebrates the sounds of cinema by showcasing an era of iconic soundtrack films, discussed by industry leaders in music and film.
metadata.Actors: Air Supply, Kevin Bacon, Christophe Beck
